maintenanceAgency.agencyName: SNAC: Social Networks and Archival Context Project

marc:datafield.marc:subfield: Organized into two groupings: 1966 Acquisition (Za Hollander) and January 2008 Acquisition (Uncat MSS 1001).
Box 23 (electronic documents) in January 2008 Acquisition (Uncat MSS 1001):
Restricted fragile material. Reference copies of electronic files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
John Hollander (b. 1929) is an American poet and literary critic, and Sterling Professor Emeritus of English at Yale University.

The collection consists of material created and accumulated by John Hollander in the course of his various literary and teaching activities. Material includes correspondence with poets, authors, critics, academics, and composers; drafts and manuscripts of poems and essays; typescripts of writings by others and related correspondence; files relating to classes taught; music material; and other papers. The collection documents Hollander's prolific career as a poet and literary critic, as well as his relationships with other key literary figures of the late twentieth and early twenty-first century.
Gift of John Hollander, 1966, and purchased from John Hollander on the Sinclair Lewis Fund, 2008.
John Hollander Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.
